page.title: 06Wormleighton Engineers
page.content: At the crossroads between Lower Boddington and Wormleighton stands Spella House, a lovely old house privately owned by a firm of agricultural engineers. It was previously used as kennels but these have now become the office and stores and the house, offices, works and paddock cover four acres. The overgrown pond at the rear of the house has been cleared by the present owners and stocked with carp. The business is based on a radius of thirty miles and moved from the town as a country location is preferable. Agricultural machinery is bought , sold and repaired here and the appropriate spares and consumables are stocked.
